page.title: 16DURSLEY FESTIVAL JUNE 1985
page.content: I enjoyed watching the traditional Morris dancing on Saturday. The Morris men did a special dance belonging to Gloucestershire. The men wore white shirts and trousers decorated with bells and ribbons. They did solo and team dances. According to custom the music is cheerful and simple and so are the steps. Sometimes women take part nowadays. On Saturday, June 15th, I went to Dursley Carnival. First I watched a procession of colourful floats. I liked the Walt Disney float of One Hundred and One Dalmatians and the Ghost Buster float. The Brownies went on foot dressed as clowns. Bands marched and played too. I followed the procession to the Recreation field where there was a steel band playing and lots of exciting stalls.
